intro: Streptocarpus eylesii subsp. brevistylus, commonly known as the Eyles' streptocarpus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its short, stout floral tubes and relatively small, rounded leaves. It prefers well-drained, sandy soils and is often found in rocky outcrops or open woodlands. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
